website_summaries.verdict: While it's not the easiest bike to assemble or the most comfortable to ride, it's affordable and has built to handle riding conditions in which speed and agility is vital.
pros: An excellent choice for riding in traffic, as the 21-speed drive train offers seamless shifting
Priced on the lower end of the spectrum
cons: Challenging to assemble, and even if you do it yourself, the brakes may need to be tweaked by a professional
Seat is hard and not very comfortable

customer_reviews.title: awesome bike
customer_reviews.text: its a nice bike and was easy enough to assemble i just wish that there were some instructions with pictures of how to do the brakes since i never did them before. but youtube helped me with that so no worries :)
customer_reviews.author: j

customer_reviews.title: Great bike at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Love this bike. Assembly was relatively simple and helps you learn how the bike works! My only complaint is/was the seat but I replaced it with a more comfortable one. It rides so smooth and shifting is a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: DEFECTIVE DERRAILURES!
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. See review below about defective derrailure. I had the same issue. Tech that assembled bike said it's a common problem. He said Amazon will not send him a new part. Instead you have to disassemble, put back in the box, and return to Amazon and wait for another bike. And hopefully the derrailure on that one isn't defective. Rather than deal with hassle, had to buy another derrailure for $30 which tech was kind enough to install. This is an inherent product fail. Class action anyone?
customer_reviews.author: Donald D Levenhagen

customer_reviews.title: I assembled my bike. They were no real instructions ...
customer_reviews.text: I assembled my bike. They were no real instructions so I used YouTube. It road a little off so I took it to a local bike shop to find out I did okay putting it together but I had a defective derailer. It cost me 75 mor dollars to do a fix that will allow for riding but eliminates one of my gears. I had called about a return but that was so complicated it was more convenient to do this fix. After working with the bike shop I realize why you should not buy a bike unsean and tested online just to save a few bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Lee A Dodd

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful lightweight bike
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful lightweight bike! I can't wait to ride this guy to class. I would highly suggest getting the bike professionally assembled if you've never assembled the bike before. The brakes are tricky and definitely the hardest part of assembly but everything else is pretty simple.
customer_reviews.author: Cherie

customer_reviews.title: Great quality bike - would recommend to anyone looking to ...
customer_reviews.text: Great quality bike - would recommend to anyone looking to do leisurely bike rides or take it on bike paths as a work out. I am 5' 4" and ordered the 15"/SM size. I have had no problems getting on this bike and stopping when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Leftys29

customer_reviews.title: Runs big! Yes, I know this isn’t clothing.
customer_reviews.text: If you are female and an average 5’6 to probably 5’8” you will want to get them small size. I am 5’6.5” and with the seat set all the way down the medium was too big. Hitting a bump and almost falling off would have ended up in a broken pubic bone. Zero shock absorption. Handles bar grips were ergonomic and comfy. Shifted fine.
customer_reviews.author: K Schultz

customer_reviews.title: A great bike.
customer_reviews.text: Best bike I've ever owned. The seat is hard but it's not too uncomfortable. Such a light bike which is important to me to be zippy and commute fast.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Good Bike!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter bought this bike. She said the assembly was easy and loves it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ling

customer_reviews.title: Mixed feelings.
customer_reviews.text: I had some trouble assembling this bike. First off, there were no assembly instructions included in the box. Getting the brakes properly adjusted was tricky (I suggest getting expert help). Also, I cannot believe there is no kickstand on this bike. I've never seen that before! I think this is more of a professional racing bike, or something. Not the kind of hybrid I was expecting. I do casual riding for exercise and this seems to be for more serious riding. However, it is beautiful and good quality.
customer_reviews.author: T. James

customer_reviews.title: the standover height was a bit too tall to be comfortable. Had to have the brakes professionally installed
customer_reviews.text: As a 5'2" female, the standover height was a bit too tall to be comfortable. Had to have the brakes professionally installed.
customer_reviews.author: jmwestplate

customer_reviews.title: For STP bike ride.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bike for my granddaughter who had out grown her 24” bike that I purchased a year and a half ago. Plan on using it for our Seattle to Portland bike ride. She loves the look and easy ride qualities that are inherent in this 21 speed flat bar bike.
customer_reviews.author: S. of Renton, Wa..

customer_reviews.title: Very poor condition
customer_reviews.text: This bike was advertised as used. I was expecting some dings here and there but there where 2-3 significant gashes across the frame. It was missing the seat lever clamp used to adjust the seat and one of the peddles threads was completely stripped out. I could not get the peddle screwed in. Needless to say, I returned it and got a full refund which was great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good, not very hard to assembly it
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, it was stolen after I used it only for 3 days, Very good, not very hard to assembly it.
customer_reviews.author: Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Bike!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great bike for me! I got a Large size I am 5'11" and it works well with me! Smooth shifts light weight great bike! The seat was a pain at first but I got used to it after three rides! I've never had a road bike either only mountain bikes so I haven't taken turns too hard yet!
customer_reviews.author: Madisen

customer_reviews.title: NO RATING LOW ENOUGH
customer_reviews.text: If I could give a 0 star rating I would. The large left-large gears won’t shift, bought it “new” and the writing on the handlebars are all scuffed, ZERO instruction for putting it together included in the box. I’m going to have to take it to a bike shop to hopefully salvage what might have been a decent bike. Exceptionally disappointed in the quality and ease of assembly of this bike. Wow.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

product_meta.title: Raleigh Alysa 1 Women's Urban Fitness Bike
product_meta.description: The alysa 1 is the entry-level bike in raleigh's, women's specific, urban fitness line. Whether you are looking for a fun ride down the local greenway or through the city on your way to work the alysa 1 is a great companion. 700C wheels keep the ride quick and efficient while flat handlebars and a sporty geometry keep the ride comfortable. 35C tires are fast rolling and smooth, but are wide enough to provide traction for an enjoyable path ride, organized ride, or your commute. The women's specific frame and components create a comfortable experience that make the bike fit a female rider, not the other way around. With 21 speeds, rack and fender mounts, and strong double wall wheels you'll always be equipped for your next two-wheel adventure. Raleigh bicycles are designed around one simple idea: fun. It's an idea that inspired the very first bikes way back in 1887 and continues to inspire how things are done today. Hop on a Raleigh and enjoy the ride
feature_bullets: Perfect for rides around town, organized rides, the bike path, or commuting to work
Women's specific frame has a lower stand over height and shorter distance from the seat to the handlebars to better fit a woman's proportions
Shimano parts flow through the 21 gears making shifting a breeze no matter what terrain is ahead of you
700x35c fast rolling tires are Big enough to keep momentum going and wide enough to keep traction on the different surfaces of your city streets
